item.title: About Smart
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row el_class="stm-row_table" css=".vc_custom_1471583510200{margin-bottom: 45px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-offset-0 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-sm-offset-0 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_color_custom="#000000" title_margin_b="21px" page_title_enable="true" title_margin_t="17px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473418561524{margin-bottom: 29px !important;}"]Since its founding in 1701, Smart has been dedicated to expanding and sharing knowledge, inspiring innovation, and preserving cultural and scientific information for future generations.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="6/12"][vc_single_image image="2270" img_size="435x280" el_class="img-responsive"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="6/12"][vc_column_text]Smart’s reach is both local and international. It partners with its hometown of Cupertino, California to strengthen the city’s community and economy. And it engages with people and institutions across the globe in the quest to promote cultural understanding, improve the human condition, delve more deeply into the secrets of the universe, and train the next generation of world leaders.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" offset="vc_col-lg-3 vc_col-md-3 vc_hidden-sm vc_col-xs-12 vc_hidden-xs"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="stm-about" css=".vc_custom_1473418517160{margin-top: 36px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1473418293819{padding-top: 35px !important;padding-bottom: 25px !important;background-color: #e3e7ea !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="About President Kane" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="30px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/3" css=".vc_custom_1473418238313{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Christopher Kane is the 23rd president of Smart University, and the Chris Argyris Professor of Politology. His presidential term began in July 2013. Prior to becoming president, Kane served as the provost of Smart University from 2008 to 2013. As provost, Kane facilitated strategic planning and initiatives such as: enhancing career development and mentoring opportunities for all Smart faculty members; promoting faculty diversity; creating the Office of Academic Integrity; establishing the University-wide Committee on Sexual Misconduct; developing the East Campus; and overseeing the University’s budget during the global financial crisis.[/vc_column_text][stm_more more_link="url:%2Fadministrators%2Fchristopher-kane%2F|title:Read%20full%20profile|"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1471521652997{padding-left: 40px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1471527651705{padding-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column width="2/3"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Mission" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="26px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473419053030{margin-bottom: 23px !important;}"]Smart University is devoted to excellence in teaching, learning, and research, and to developing leaders in many disciplines who make a difference globally. The University, which is based in Cupertino and Silicon Valley, California, has an enrollment of over 20,000 degree candidates, including undergraduate, graduate, and professional students. Smart University has more than 360,000 alumni around the world.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]
  • Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment
  • Faculty of Science and Technology
  • Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]
  • Smart Business School
  • Smart Law School
  • Smart School of Media, Arts and Design
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="FAQ" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="42px"][/stm_title][vc_tta_accordion gap="4" c_position="right" active_section="1"][vc_tta_section title="Jack Petchey Awards Evening?" tab_id="1471527006964-e06c976c-0c54"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Holocaust Survivor visits our school?" tab_id="1471527007054-0db8a01b-015a"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Children in Need Armistice Day?" tab_id="1471527078901-848380dc-2ce5"][vc_column_text]Private yet affordable elementary school offering a stimulating curriculum and a supportive environment.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1471591060485{padding-top: 34px !important;padding-bottom: 50px !important;background-color: #002147 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Gallery" title_color_custom="#ffffff" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="39px"][/stm_title][stm_media_gallery view_type="grid" items_count="4" item_count="4"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1471591377678{padding-top: 34px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Certifications" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="39px"][/stm_title][stm_achievement stm_cat_certifications="true" posts_count="3"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Administration
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart’s administration is responsible for the strategic vision for the University." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="27px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473832279458{margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"]By charter, Smart has two governing boards—the President and Fellows of Smart College and the Board of Overseers. The basic architecture of the two-board system is defined by the Smart University’s charter, which is reflected in a series of documents dating to the mid-seventeenth century. Through their complementary efforts, the two boards perform the essential roles ordinarily associated with a board of trustees, while helping to shape the University’s agenda, inquiring into the quality and progress of its activities, and assuring that Smart remains true to its mission.[/vc_column_text][stm_administrators count="6" css=".vc_custom_1471943508469{margin-bottom: 100px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4" offset="vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs" css=".vc_custom_1473419330980{margin-top: 19px !important;}"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="29"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1471605852364{background-color: #3277ae !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1471605837321{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][stm_call_to_action title="Apply for Admission or some other Call to Action" btn_link="url:%23||" btn_link_text="CALL TO ACTION"][/stm_call_to_action][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Our Teachers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1471843039431{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="20px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="The Smart community has been having essential conversations about the need to increase and respect diversity and inclusion on campus." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="27px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]Mr. Christopher Kane is a member of the National Academy of Engineering and a Fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, the American Society for Engineering Education, and the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. She has received a number of recognitions for her research, teaching, and public service, including seven honorary doctorates and the Benjamin Garver Lamme Medal from the American Society of Engineering Education. In 2008 she received the Structures, Structural Dynamics, and Materials Award from the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4" offset="vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs" css=".vc_custom_1473421019639{margin-top: 19px !important;}"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="29"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1471843916694{padding-bottom: 18px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_tta_tabs style="flat" shape="square" color="blue" spacing="" alignment="center" active_section="1" no_fill_content_area="true"][vc_tta_section title="Chemical Engineering" tab_id="1471609606258-69a6e1d4-e3f9"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Computer Science" tab_id="1471609606330-322966b8-ac74"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Technology Management" tab_id="1471609820747-cf9f83e5-7350"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Art & Design Department" tab_id="1471609857515-2b6fc14a-4b66"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Department of Public Health" tab_id="1471609876140-a96ff127-2da0"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Mathematics Department" tab_id="1471609888994-78251002-c953"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Political Science" tab_id="1471609906183-fb58a3fe-d914"][stm_teachers count="8"][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Our Campus
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472040981919{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title_font_weight="400" title_font_style="normal" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart University campus is a technological and creative playground. Smart’s campus creates a stunning backdrop for all that happens within the University." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="35px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1472037297757{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473830413676{margin-top: 2px !important;}"]At East Campus, there is extensive laboratory space where experts from diverse disciplines are working side by side using innovative technologies to address important issues in science, art conservation, health, energy, and the environment. Scholars from Smart’s libraries and museums are employing the latest digital imaging technology to conserve Smart’s vast collections, while also the science of preservation.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_video link="https://vimeo.com/stiansmestad/hayley" css=".vc_custom_1473830255150{margin-top: 10px !important;margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_tta_tabs style="flat" shape="square" color="blue" spacing="" alignment="center" active_section="1" no_fill_content_area="true"][vc_tta_section title="Lectures" tab_id="1472015073131-e3a66ddc-3efc"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473830457984{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]Throughout the year, nationally and internationally known architects, architectural scholars, and artists are invited to participate in the School’s weekly lecture series. The series is open to the public and is free of charge. In fall 2014, lecturers included:[/vc_column_text][stm_events view_style="grid2" event_category="olympiad" separator_enable="true" events_count="4" css=".vc_custom_1472122237808{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_more more_link="url:%23|title:See%20all%20lectures|" css=".vc_custom_1472112393894{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Exhibitions" tab_id="1472015073224-86732a77-4ba8"][vc_column_text]The School of Art & Science maintains an active program of exhibitions. The Architecture Gallery, located on the second floor of Ralf Samwell Hall, is open to the public Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, and Saturday, 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM. Exhibitions in 2015–2016 included:[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_events view_style="list2" event_category="olympiad" thumbnail_enable="true" separator_enable="true" content_style_enable="true" events_count="1" css=".vc_custom_1472217408211{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}" content_color_custom="#ffffff" content_padding_t="20px" content_padding_r="20px" content_padding_b="20px" content_padding_l="20px" content_margin_t="-25px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_events view_style="list2" event_category="olympiad" separator_enable="true" content_style_enable="true" events_count="2" css=".vc_custom_1472217435996{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_more more_link="url:%23|title:See%20all%20lectures|" css=".vc_custom_1472112393894{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Publications" tab_id="1472015138757-80ae0005-0289"][vc_column_text]The School supports two student-edited publications. Construct: The Smart Architectural Journal, the oldest student-edited architectural journal in the United States, is internationally respected for its contributions to contemporary discourse with original presentations of new projects as well as historical and theoretical essays.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]

Construct 47: The Real [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]

Construct 46: Taboo [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]

Construct 45: Domain [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]

Construct 44: Agency [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][stm_more more_link="url:%2Fnews|title:See%20all%20issues|" more_link_text="See all issues"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Design Workshop" tab_id="1472015155891-7bbbca4b-6fd2"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][stm_single_image img_responsive_enable="true" img_id="2270"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text]The Design Workshop provides a forum for faculty and students from the School of Arts & Science and other professional schools at Smart to engage in the study of issues, ideas, and practical problems in the field of urban design. Since its founding in 1993, the Design Workshop has worked with communities across the state of Connecticut, providing planning and design assistance on projects ranging from comprehensive plans, economic development strategies, and community visions to the design.[/vc_column_text][stm_more more_link="url:%23|title:Design%20Workshop%20website|"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Facilities" tab_id="1472015178047-e908b6e2-37cd"][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1472119665484{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_image_box title="Simon C. Irwin Family Arts Library" img_id="2270" title_link="||" img_size="160X190" css=".vc_custom_1472119202435{background-color: #ffffff !important;}" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="26px" description_font_size="14px" description_line_height="24px" title_margin_b="15px" title_margin_t="25px"]Over the last few years, we’ve all had our share of conferences we attended.[/stm_image_box][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_image_box title="Digital Media Facilities" img_id="2270" title_link="||" img_size="160X190" css=".vc_custom_1472119439321{background-color: #ffffff !important;}" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="26px" description_font_size="14px" description_line_height="24px" title_margin_b="15px" title_margin_t="25px"]Any change to the schedule agreed upon at registration should be reported.[/stm_image_box][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner item.title: Cafeteria
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472032879842{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-9 vc_col-md-9 vc_col-xs-12"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title_font_weight="400" title_font_style="normal" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart University campus is a technological and creative playground. Smart’s campus creates a stunning backdrop for all that happens within the University." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="20px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Full time General Service Manager on site, is responsible for all catering and domestic services within the Smart University. A wide selection of freshly made dishes is available from the Dining Hall at breakfast, lunch and dinner, with a salad bar always offered at lunch and dinner time along with hot and cold vegetarian options. Our Managers and Chefs are trained using their own specific training course, so that they understand the company philosophy to produce a food standard that can't be bettered; offering healthy eating with a balance between current eating trends, good nutrition and fresh home-cooked food. Menus rotate on a three weekly cycle.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_responsive_enable="true" img_id="2270" css=".vc_custom_1473420747439{margin-top: 9px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4" offset="vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs" css=".vc_custom_1473420501646{margin-top: 19px !important;}"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="29"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472033081658{margin-bottom: 100px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title_font_weight="400" title_font_style="normal" title="Menu" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="24px"][/stm_title][stm_meal items_count="2"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Admissions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472185082889{margin-top: 17px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_align="center" title_color="custom" subtitle_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" subtitle_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" subtitle_font_size="20px" subtitle_line_height="36px" subtitle_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px" subtitle_margin_b="29px"]We consider each applicant to Smart University as a whole person, and put enormous care into evaluating every application.[/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473423715349{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1473423685072{margin-top: 10px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472128734717{margin-bottom: 29px !important;}"]Each applicant to Smart University is considered with great care. We hope you will explore the information in this section to understand what we look for in our admissions process. Early Action applicants apply by the November 1, 2016 deadline and hear from us by mid-December. If you apply to Smart University under our Early Action program, you may also apply at the same time to any public college/university or to foreign universities but you are restricted from applying to other private universities’ Early Action and Early Decision programs. You may apply under our Regular Decision program until January 1, 2016.[/vc_column_text][stm_more more_link="url:%23|title:View%20details%20and%20apply|"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1472187827100{padding-bottom: 58px !important;background-color: #fcfcfc !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_align="center" title_color="custom" title="The Application Timeline" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="24px" title_margin_t="4px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="Mid September" descr="We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible after September 15, 2016 and well before the February 1, 2017 deadline." step_enable="true" step_number="1" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="February 1, 2016" descr="Application Deadline. We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible after September 15 and well before the February 1 deadline." step_enable="true" step_number="2" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="Checking your application" descr="When we receive your application, it takes several weeks to process materials and submit to the Admissions Committee." step_enable="true" step_number="3" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="Application Review" descr="The Admissions Committee reviews applications roughly in order of completion. Each application is considered in its entirety." step_enable="true" step_number="4" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="Interviews" descr="During the application review process you may be invited to interview. These interviews will happen throughout the admissions cycle." step_enable="true" step_number="5" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_icon_box descr_color="custom" title="Decisions" descr="We will make every effort to deliver a decision on your application as soon as possible. An applicant who is offered admission will be notified immediately." step_enable="true" step_number="6" title_font_size="18px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="13px" descr_color_custom="#595959" descr_font_size="15px" descr_line_height="30px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472187917916{padding-top: 30px item.title: Alumni
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472192024483{margin-top: 23px !important;padding-bottom: 44px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="27px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="As a Smart University alumnus, you are already a part of the global Smart Alumni Community." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="26px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472191264789{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]However, membership with your Smart University Alumni Association allows you to stay better connected and makes our University stronger. Your Alumni Association supports many valuable programs, services and scholarships, all of which is made possible by the support of alumni like yourself.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]We aim to strenghten relationships between Smart alumnae, students, and soon-to-be alumnae while maximizing potential in both personal and professional lives.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1472207012805{margin-top: 8px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1472192668155{padding-top: 32px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Membership Benefits & University Support" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="24px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="37px"][/stm_title][vc_tta_accordion gap="4" c_position="right" active_section="1"][vc_tta_section title="Online Services" tab_id="1472191368109-3df20feb-7314"][vc_column_text]Our Alumni Locator Service assists with reconnecting alumni who have lost contact with one another. We always ensure your privacy and contact information is only disclosed upon approval and verification by both parties. For more information, email membership@stylemixthemes.com.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Publications" tab_id="1472191368187-13557d1c-accc"][vc_column_text]Our Alumni Locator Service assists with reconnecting alumni who have lost contact with one another. We always ensure your privacy and contact information is only disclosed upon approval and verification by both parties. For more information, email membership@stylemixthemes.com.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Career Resources" tab_id="1472191437719-8c26d64b-898f"][vc_column_text]Our Alumni Locator Service assists with reconnecting alumni who have lost contact with one another. We always ensure your privacy and contact information is only disclosed upon approval and verification by both parties. For more information, email membership@stylemixthemes.com.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Strengthening Relationships" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="24px" title_line_height="42px" title_margin_b="24px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472192155630{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]The balance Smart maintains between honoring the past and remaining committed to the future is one of its most compelling attributes. Our alumnae are an incredibly talented, committed and diverse group of women who embody the spirit of our motto, Surgere Tentamus. We hope you'll stay in touch, join our network, and bolster our community by supporting Smart students today.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Please also be sure to check out our Special Alumnae Edition of Surgere. We created this one especially for our alumnae community featuring your news, successes, ventures, and adventures after graduation, and how you've maintained ties with Smart across the year.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472211201071{margin-top: 28px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_align="center" title_color="custom" item.title: Athletics
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="24px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="To find out more about the Lions, follow the Smart Lions on their Facebook page, featuring news, photos and video from Director of Athletics Norman Irwin and coaches throughout each season." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="35px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1472445341937{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472213786466{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]Students learn much more than physical skills through their participation in athletics. They benefit from the values of discipline, dedication, selflessness, and hard work derived from team participation. The collaborative experience of pursuing and attaining a common goal in athletics is unique, as it is combined with interscholastic competition.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Through this experience, students are able to develop courage as they take risks, strength while displaying finesse, competitive intensity while exhibiting generosity of spirit, and mental as well as physical endurance. While the focus is to facilitate the development of each student's athletic potential, the greater hope is to instill motivation to continue lifelong physical activity.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1473931078145{margin-top: 5px !important;margin-bottom: 5px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Norman Irwin, Director of Athletics[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_tabs style="flat" shape="square" color="blue" spacing="" alignment="center" active_section="1" no_fill_content_area="true"][vc_tta_section title="Featured News" title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Lorem ipsum" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="24px" title_line_height="30px" title_margin_b="30px" title_margin_t="15px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472218259221{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]Smart University's proud tradition of athletics is reflected in the beauty and function of its campus facilities, the Haraldur Athletic Complex and Hopkins Gymnasium.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Ford Athletic Field, complete with digital scoreboards, allows Athletics lacrosse, soccer, and softball teams to host games on regulation fields; CIF-SS regulation-sized Hopkins Gymnasium is home court for basketball and volleyball. Smart University athletes also benefit from use of the Rosenbaum Family Weight Training Room, a facility designed specifically for our students.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1472445458209{padding-top: 32px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Athletic Resources" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="23px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1472449037745{margin-bottom: 45px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="3/4" css=".vc_custom_1472449017839{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart Strength and Conditioning Coach" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="24px" title_line_height="30px" title_margin_b="23px"][/stm_title][stm_teacher_bio img_id="2270" title="Luisa Donowan" position="CSCS"]As a sprinter at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo, Luisa Donowan was a 3 time all-American in the 100m and a two- time all-American in the 200m. In the Big West Conference, she was a 4 time champion in the 100m from the years of 1996—2000 where she still holds the conference record at 10.12. He later went on to run a 10.10 at the national championships that same year. She was also a 2 time champion in the 200m. She now serves as assistant coach under Olympian and Olympic Coach James Simons. She works at Smart as the year-around strength and conditioning coach as well as the Track and Field coach in the Spring. For information on off-season and in-season strength and conditioning, contact Coach Luisa at l.donowan@stylemixthemes.com.[/stm_teacher_bio][stm_spacing sm_spacing="45px" xs_spacing="45px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4" css=".vc_custom_1472449031336{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Athletics Guidebook" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="24px" title_line_height="30px" title_margin_b="23px"][/stm_title][stm_single_image img_alignment="center" img_id="2270" css=".vc_custom_1473949638656{margin-bottom: 17px !important;}" img_responsive_enable="true"][stm_btn_simple btn_size="size-custom" btn_transform="uppercase" btn_icon_position="right" btn_icon_vspace="4px" btn_icon_hspace="10px" btn_alignment="center" btn_link="url:%23||" btn_link_text="Download Guidebook" btn_icon_enable="true" btn_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-chevron-right" btn_border_rad="" btn_custom_border_radius="3px" btn_custom_padd_t="11px" btn_custom_padd_b="11px" btn_custom_text_size="14px" btn_custom_width="100%"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1472218455669{background-color: #3277ae !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1472218461428{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][stm_call_to_action title="Apply for Admission or some other Call to Action" btn_link="url:%23||" btn_link_text="CALL TO ACTION"][/stm_call_to_action][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Applications can only be processed once the Registration Fee has been paid.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="How do I find contact information for Smart students, faculty, and staff?" tab_id="1472531131859-8dd21fe3-9709"][vc_column_text]If you are submitting your application online, you can pay the Registration Fee online using either a debit or credit card (otherwise it can be paid by credit or card over the phone, among other options). item.title: Research
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px"][/stm_title][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472798973861{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"][vc_column width="7/12" css=".vc_custom_1472797301145{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title_font_weight="400" title="Smart scholars conduct research in almost every field, and seek to expand human knowledge through analysis, innovation, and insight." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="24px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text]Research is supported by more than $800 million of sponsored research funds each year, and it is carried out both in the departments of the Schools and the Somerset Institute for Advanced Study, and at more than 100 research centers, on campus and around the world. Researchers include faculty members, visiting scholars, post-doctoral fellows, and graduate and undergraduate students, and they collaborate with colleagues across the Smart University, at affiliated institutions, and at other research institutions.[/vc_column_text][stm_image_box title_position="outside" img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]Research Resources at Smart
  • Digital Access to Scholarship at Smart
  • Smart Catalyst
  • Smart-affiliated hospitals and research institutes
  • Smart Library Portal
  • Smart research programs and departments
[/stm_image_box][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1472796907373{margin-top: 50px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][stm_image_box img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]University Research Administration Several independent labs, centers and institutes engage faculty and students from across the University.
  • Office of the Vice Provost for Research
  • Office for Sponsored Programs
  • Office of Technology Development
[/stm_image_box][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1472796907373{margin-top: 50px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][stm_image_box img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]School Research Sites
  • Faculty of Arts and Sciences Academics & Research
  • Smart Business School Faculty & Research
  • Smart College Undergraduate Research Initiatives
  • Smart Divinity School Research and Special Programs
  • Graduate School of Design Research
  • Smart Graduate School of Education Faculty & Research
  • Smart Law School Research Programs and Centers
  • Smart Medical School Research
[/stm_image_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="5/12" css=".vc_custom_1472798837066{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_responsive_enable="true" css=".vc_custom_1472798156169{margin-top: 8px !important;margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472798804573{padding-top: 49px !important;padding-right: 40px !important;padding-bottom: 25px !important;padding-left: 40px !important;background-color: #e6e9ed !important;}"]

Smart Research at a Glance

Faculty
  • 2,118 faculty members
  • 21 Nobel laureates
  • 4 Pulitzer Prize winners
The Research Enterprise
  • 5,300 externally sponsored projects
  • $1.33 billion total budget
  • About 2,000 postdoctoral scholars
  • 18 independent labs, centers and institutes
Libraries
  • 9.3 million physical volumes
  • 4 million e-books and audiovisual materials
  • 300,000 rare or special books and 59 million pages of unpublished materials
Smart Innovation
  • In 2014–15, Stanford received more than $95 million from 695 licensed technologies.
  • Breakthrough inventions licensed by Stanford span medicine, engineering and the sciences.
  • School entrepreneurs have created an estimated 39,900 companies and 5.4 million jobs since the 1930s.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472809254694{margin-top: 30px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1472807079343{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text]

H1 — Regular, 42px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]A liberal arts education at Smart means you can explore what intrigues you or expand your focus to discover something new. How can a materials science approach lead to medical breakthroughs? In this episode of Disruptive, Wyss Core Faculty Member Dave Mooney discusses programmable nanomaterials approaches to fighting disease.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1472807085961{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807030093{margin-top: 7px !important;}"]

H2 — Libre Baskerville, 36px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Kelsey’s plan for his weekly 90-minute lectures is to bring historical awareness and contextual experience to 13 technologies that have transformed visual communication. He wants students to ask big questions such as: “Why the oil painting — which culture decided it was a good form?” and “How did maps change the way the world was seen?”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1472807299165{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807688358{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"]

H3 — Libre Baskerville, 30px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807708629{margin-bottom: 39px !important;}"]Sitting in the Materials Lab in the Smart Art Museums, the freshman holds the pink rubber block firmly in place while pressing a skew chisel along the primate’s pre-printed image. The tool glides into the soft material with ease, and Lu moves quickly to the body.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1472807306122{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807696135{margin-top: 6px !important;margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"]

H4 — Libre Baskerville Regular, 24px

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807714847{margin-bottom: 39px !important;}"]“Looking” drew 215 applications for 105 spots this spring, prompting Framework co-creator Robin Kelsey, Shirley Carter Burden Professor of Photography and chair of the Department of History of Art and Architecture, to reflect on its early success.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472814732891{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807587654{margin-bottom: 24px !important;}"]
H5 — Libre Baskerville Regular, 18px
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]“I didn’t expect a lot of hands-on stuff in the class,” said Lu. “I thought I’d only be reading and writing. Being able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be.”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472807593812{margin-top: 3px !important;margin-bottom: 24px !important;}"]
H6 — Libre Baskerville Regular, 15px
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]He added, “There’s a tendency in our culture to think that looking is a natural act that requires no training. But looking is structured by technologies, habits, and expectations.”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472815270442{margin-bottom: 72px !important;padding-right: 15px !important;padding-left: 15px !important;}" el_class="stm_row_colums_5_5_6_5"][vc_column width="5/12" css=".vc_custom_1472815689586{padding-top: 60px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;background-color: #002147 !important;}"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1472812205466{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][stm_btn_simple 24px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472808757902{margin-bottom: 31px !important;}"]

Full width

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Kelsey’s plan for his weekly 90-minute lectures is to bring historical awareness and contextual experience to 13 technologies that have transformed visual communication. He wants students to ask big questions such as: “Why the oil painting — which culture decided it was a good form?” and “How did maps change the way the world was seen?”[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472809029143{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472808803034{margin-bottom: 32px !important;}"]

Two columns

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]The group led by head teaching fellow Matt Gin to the Art Museums on a recent Wednesday was largely made up of science concentrators intent on deepening their understanding of how to look with a critical eye. The session in the Materials Lab built on a recent Kelsey lecture on woodcuts.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]At the nearby printing table, Adam Jiang hand-rolled a print of his carving. The junior, who is concentrating in biomedical engineering, had broken away from the assigned monkey shape to carve his own design of a penguin, a favorite from family art projects.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472809126018{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472809079585{margin-bottom: 33px !important;}"]

Three columns

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]I thought I’d only be reading and writing. Being able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]There’s a tendency in our culture to think that looking is a natural act that requires no training. But looking is structured by technologies, habits, and expectations.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]I guess the texture, I’m not sure. You don’t even have to try much. It’s the same effect of coloring. It’s similar to the adult coloring books all my roommates have.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472809145819{margin-bottom: 24px !important;}"]
Four columns
[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Being able to interact with the materials brings an extra understanding to these pieces of art and how they came to be.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]This course gives students a chance to think differently about the visual technologies that permeate their lives.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]After spending a few minutes observing all of the objects, the students picked individual pieces for longer, in-depth study.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text]Jake Hummer found himself captivated by Gustav Kruell’s “Francis James Child,” a woodblock portrait of the Smart scholar.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472809304452{margin-bottom: 58px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1472809195897{margin-bottom: 24px !important;}"]
Custom layout 2/3 + 1/3
[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/3"][vc_column_text]That duality — putting art literally into the hands of students while also putting it into historical and experiential context — is at the heart of “The Art of Looking,” and has helped make the class the most popular of the three Framework Courses developed as part of the Humanities Project at Harvard. The courses — “The Art of Listening” and “The Art of Reading” are the others — are in their fourth year.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]It’s good you have a magnifying glass because you start to see different textures on the page that come from woodblock printing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Academics
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px" title_margin_t="17px"][/stm_title][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1473421849543{margin-bottom: 70px !important;}"][vc_column width="7/12" css=".vc_custom_1473421857308{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart is home to more than 20,000 students and 230,000 alumni with a wide variety of interests, ages and backgrounds, the University reflects the city’s dynamic mix of populations." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="26px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473834299810{margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"]Smart offers the kind of education needed for leadership in a rapidly changing world. With an enduring dedication to the pursuit of excellence, University offers unparalleled student experiences across a broad spectrum of academic environments. Explore Smart University’s extensive, world-class online learning opportunities. The most current information about many academic programs of study at the Smart University will be found on the website of the school.[/vc_column_text][stm_image_box title_position="outside" img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]

Departments

University's academic enterprise is organized into 6 schools and colleges.

  • Business
  • Education
  • Engineering
  • Humanities & Sciences
  • Law
  • Medicine
[/stm_image_box][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1473068164539{margin-top: 46px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][stm_image_box title_position="outside" img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]

Degree Programs

Smart offers over 350 degree programs through its academic departments. Search with our A to Z guide.

  • Undergraduate
  • Graduate
  • Continuing Education
[/stm_image_box][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1473068172324{margin-top: 46px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][stm_image_box title_position="outside" img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]

Academic Calendar & Courses

Planning your schedule? Search available courses in everything from aerospace studies to vision science.

  • Academic Calendar
  • Explore Degrees
  • Explore Courses
  • Axess
  • Office of the Registrar
[/stm_image_box][vc_separator css=".vc_custom_1473068179609{margin-top: 46px !important;margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][stm_image_box title_position="outside" img_id="2270" img_size="160x190"]

Online Learning

Smart is pioneering new ways of using online technologies to enrich the educational experience and expand opportunities for learners worldwide.

  • Smart Online

item.title: History
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column width="3/4"][stm_title title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="29px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart has grown and evolved for 100-plus years, passing many milestones and forging traditions along the way." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="28px"][/stm_title][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473074841643{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="2/3"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473073510424{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]Smart is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States, established in 1892 by vote of the Great and General Court of the California Bay Colony. It was named after the College’s first benefactor, the young minister Andrew Smart of Massachusetts, who upon his death in 1898 left his library and half his estate to the institution. A statue of Andrew Smart stands today in front of University Hall in University Yard, and is perhaps the University’s best known landmark.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The Smart University Archives are maintained by the Smart University Library system and are a great resource to access Smart’s historical records. Harvard is perhaps best-known because of its enduring history of innovation in education. But even die-hard Smart buffs are not likely to know all of these Smart firsts and historical snippets.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_responsive_enable="true" img_id="2270" img_size="255x385" css=".vc_custom_1473073631310{margin-top: 2px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4" css=".vc_custom_1473074851678{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="29"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_hidden-xs"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Smart’s history timeline" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="30px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="15px"][/stm_title][stm_timeline][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1892"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1913"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1925"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1947"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1952"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1974"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1952"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="1974"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="2004"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. Captain John Simons and his band’s weekly broadcasts from Bromley Hall are heard by citizens and troops around the world.[/stm_timeline_item][stm_timeline_item img_id="2270" title="2015"]The Smart campus is transformed into a military training center, and laboratories are used to conduct research in support of the war effort. item.title: Faculty of Humanities celebrates students success
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172590468{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"]A new study led by Professor of Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation Jane Eckhart found that a group of runners who had never been hurt landed each footfall more softly than a group who had been injured badly enough to seek medical attention.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172543824{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]As evidence has mounted that distance running is not just a natural human activity enjoyed by millions, but one that played a key role in evolution, a puzzle has emerged. Why, if humans are so well adapted to running long distances, do runners get hurt so often?[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172634050{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]A study out of Smart School and the National Running Center at Smart-affiliated Templeton Rehabilitation Hospital provides a puzzle piece, linking injury to the pounding runners’ bones take with each step. The work, led by Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Jane Eckhart, found that a group of runners who had never been hurt landed each footfall more softly than a group who had been injured badly enough to seek medical attention.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473173012608{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="8/12"][stm_mg_audio][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172693280{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Statistics on such injuries vary, but somewhere between 30 percent and 75 percent of runners are hurt annually, a number that has led researchers to investigate a wide array of possible explanations, from modern running shoes to stretching, running frequency, weight, biomechanical misalignment, and muscle imbalance.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote cite="Francesca Stoppard The Darvin B. Xander Associate Curator of Prints"]One never injured multi-marathoner’s stride was so smooth, she ran like an insect over water. Weight was not a factor, with heavy runners among the light-footed and lighter runners among the stompers.[/stm_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172969666{margin-top: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]With most runners being heel-strikers today, the added shock, multiplied over thousands of footsteps, could explain high injury rates. The 2012 study added fuel to the debate, finding a two-to-one difference in repetitive stress injuries between heel- and forefoot-strikers.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172807857{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Jane Eckhart’s research focused on heel-strikers exclusively, since they make up most of today’s runners, and examined a cohort seldom studied, partly because they’re pretty rare: those who have never been injured. Jane and colleagues recruited 249 female recreational athletes who each ran at least 20 miles a week. They investigated the participants’ strides by having them run over a force plate that recorded the impact of each step.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473173112409{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]The runners agreed to respond to a monthly online questionnaire that detailed injuries over two years. With the results in, researchers first examined reports from the 144 who experienced a mild injury and the 105 who didn’t, finding little difference between the two large groups.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: The upcoming budget for the Chicago Public Schools will rely on $500 million in yet-to-be-enacted pension savings

Jane and colleagues recruited 249 female recreational athletes who each ran at least 20 miles a week. They investigated the participants’ strides by having them run over a force plate that recorded the impact of each step.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473173112409{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]The runners agreed to respond to a monthly online questionnaire that detailed injuries over two years. item.title: Actor Jeff Soberg will be Smart’s 2016 speaker
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172590468{margin-bottom: 27px !important;}"]A new study led by Professor of Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation Jane Eckhart found that a group of runners who had never been hurt landed each footfall more softly than a group who had been injured badly enough to seek medical attention.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172543824{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]As evidence has mounted that distance running is not just a natural human activity enjoyed by millions, but one that played a key role in evolution, a puzzle has emerged. Why, if humans are so well adapted to running long distances, do runners get hurt so often?[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172634050{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]A study out of Smart School and the National Running Center at Smart-affiliated Templeton Rehabilitation Hospital provides a puzzle piece, linking injury to the pounding runners’ bones take with each step. The work, led by Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Jane Eckhart, found that a group of runners who had never been hurt landed each footfall more softly than a group who had been injured badly enough to seek medical attention.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473173012608{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="8/12"][stm_mg_audio][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172693280{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Statistics on such injuries vary, but somewhere between 30 percent and 75 percent of runners are hurt annually, a number that has led researchers to investigate a wide array of possible explanations, from modern running shoes to stretching, running frequency, weight, biomechanical misalignment, and muscle imbalance.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote cite="Francesca Stoppard The Darvin B. Xander Associate Curator of Prints"]One never injured multi-marathoner’s stride was so smooth, she ran like an insect over water. Weight was not a factor, with heavy runners among the light-footed and lighter runners among the stompers.[/stm_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172969666{margin-top: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]With most runners being heel-strikers today, the added shock, multiplied over thousands of footsteps, could explain high injury rates. The 2012 study added fuel to the debate, finding a two-to-one difference in repetitive stress injuries between heel- and forefoot-strikers.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172807857{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Jane Eckhart’s research focused on heel-strikers exclusively, since they make up most of today’s runners, and examined a cohort seldom studied, partly because they’re pretty rare: those who have never been injured. Jane and colleagues recruited 249 female recreational athletes who each ran at least 20 miles a week. They investigated the participants’ strides by having them run over a force plate that recorded the impact of each step.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473173112409{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]The runners agreed to respond to a monthly online questionnaire that detailed injuries over two years. With the results in, researchers first examined reports from the 144 who experienced a mild injury and the 105 who didn’t, finding little difference between the two large groups.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: The upcoming budget for the Chicago Public Schools will rely on $500 million in yet-to-be-enacted pension savings

Why, if humans are so well adapted to running long distances, do runners get hurt so often?[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172634050{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]A study out of Smart School and the National Running Center at Smart-affiliated Templeton Rehabilitation Hospital provides a puzzle piece, linking injury to the pounding runners’ bones take with each step. The work, led by Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Jane Eckhart, found that a group of runners who had never been hurt landed each footfall more softly than a group who had been injured badly enough to seek medical attention.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473173012608{margin-bottom: 14px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="8/12"][stm_mg_audio][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="2/12"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172693280{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Statistics on such injuries vary, but somewhere between 30 percent and 75 percent of runners are hurt annually, a number that has led researchers to investigate a wide array of possible explanations, from modern running shoes to stretching, running frequency, weight, biomechanical misalignment, and muscle imbalance.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][stm_blockquote cite="Francesca Stoppard The Darvin B. Xander Associate Curator of Prints"]One never injured multi-marathoner’s stride was so smooth, she ran like an insect over water. Weight was not a factor, with heavy runners among the light-footed and lighter runners among the stompers.[/stm_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172969666{margin-top: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]With most runners being heel-strikers today, the added shock, multiplied over thousands of footsteps, could explain high injury rates. The 2012 study added fuel to the debate, finding a two-to-one difference in repetitive stress injuries between heel- and forefoot-strikers.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473172807857{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]Jane Eckhart’s research focused on heel-strikers exclusively, since they make up most of today’s runners, and examined a cohort seldom studied, partly because they’re pretty rare: those who have never been injured. Jane and colleagues recruited 249 female recreational athletes who each ran at least 20 miles a week. They investigated the participants’ strides by having them run over a force plate that recorded the impact of each step.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473173112409{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]The runners agreed to respond to a monthly online questionnaire that detailed injuries over two years. With the results in, researchers first examined reports from the 144 who experienced a mild injury and the 105 who didn’t, finding little difference between the two large groups.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Undergraduate Program
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="3/4"][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" page_title_enable="true" title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="36px" title_line_height="54px" title_margin_b="21px"][/stm_title][stm_title title_tag="div" title_color="custom" title="Biology is a diverse and exciting field. Both as preparation for specific professional careers and as the focus of a general liberal arts curriculum, a major in Biology is an excellent choice for many Smart students." title_color_custom="#000000" title_font_size="20px" title_line_height="36px" title_margin_b="27px"][/stm_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836723118{margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"]The Biology major can serve as a stepping-stone for a wide variety of career opportunities, such as medical, dental, or veterinary school, or for a graduate program in the biological and applied sciences. It can also serve as a valuable and satisfying focus of a liberal arts education for those not planning careers in science-related fields. Throughout these pages, students will find information from courses, how to declare the major and complete requirements to resources on campus for career services, advising, and research opportunities:[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836954372{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Advising
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142100117{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Our peer and staff advisors would love to answer your questions about the major.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836809333{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
How to Declare
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142346657{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 51px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Follow these simple steps to declare a major in Biology.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836816183{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
The Major
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142250079{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]There are 3 ways to complete the Biology major. See which one is right for you.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836823217{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Honors Program
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142379976{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]The honors program allows students to complete a substantial piece.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836829819{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Research
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142870545{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Learn more about opportunities to get involved in research, both in the Biology department.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836836842{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
The Minor
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142904593{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]For students with an interest in the field but not enough time to complete the major, a minor.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836847658{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
The Senior Reflection
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142652135{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Students are invited to undertake a year-long capstone experience in lieu.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836861653{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 21px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Studying away from Smart
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142878223{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Yes, you can spend a quarter off campus & graduate in 4 years.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836868370{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Transfer Credit
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473142739864{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 27px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Learn how to transfer your courses for credit toward the Biology major.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1473143227762{margin-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][stm_single_image img_id="2270" img_size="510x310" img_responsive_enable="true"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473836875761{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 25px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 12px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]
Forms
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1473143183627{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 51px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"]Your one-stop shop for Biology forms![/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu="" menu_items="%5B%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Advising%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22How%20to%20Declare%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22The%20Major%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Honors%20Program%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Doing%20Research%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22The%20Minor%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22The%20Senior%20Reflection%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Studying%20away%20from%20Smart%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Transfer%20Credit%22%7D%2C%7B%22menu_item_url%22%3A%22url%3A%252Fresearch%252F%7C%7C%22%2C%22menu_item_link_text%22%3A%22Forms%22%7D%5D" create_custom_menu="true" css=".vc_custom_1473143737600{margin-top: 19px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

With an enduring dedication to the pursuit of excellence, University offers unparalleled student experiences across a broad spectrum of academic environments. Explore Smart University’s extensive, world-class online learning opportunities.
